Ingredients.5: 1 cup crunchy peanut butter (such as Jif® Extra Crunchy)

Directions.1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).

Directions.2: Line 2 baking sheets with parchment paper.

Directions.3: Mix the milk and vanilla extract together in a small bowl; set aside.

Directions.4: Combine the flour and baking powder in a separate bowl.

Directions.5: Beat the peanut butter, brown sugar, and white sugar with an electric mixer in a large bowl until smooth.

Directions.6: Add the eggs one at a time, allowing each egg to blend into the peanut butter mixture before adding the next.

Directions.7: Pour in the flour mixture alternately with the milk, mixing until just incorporated.

Directions.8: Fold in the peanut butter chips; mixing just enough to evenly combine.

Directions.9: Divide the dough into 4 equal parts.

Directions.10: Roll each section into a 4x5-inch rectangle about 1/2-inch thick.

Directions.11: Transfer the dough pieces onto the prepared baking sheets.

Directions.12: Bake in the preheated oven until firm to the touch, about 25 minutes.

Directions.13: Place biscotti loaves on wire racks to cool.

Directions.14: Reduce oven temperature to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C).

Directions.16: Return the slices to the baking sheets with the cut sides up.

Directions.17: Bake in the oven until biscotti are dry, about 10 minutes on each side.

Directions.18: Cool in the pans for 10 minutes before removing to cool completely on a wire rack.

Directions.19: Melt the chocolate chips in a microwave-safe glass or ceramic bowl in 30-second intervals, stirring after each interval, until melted and smooth, 1 to 3 minutes (depending on your microwave).

Directions.20: Dip the cooled biscotti into the melted chocolate. Set the biscotti onto parchment paper, and allow to set, about 20 minutes.
